tit.e: Saimen no Bushi (Group of Warriors Guarding West Side of Imperial Palace)
Saimen no Bushi (Group of Warriors Guarding West Side of Imperial Palace)
Saimen no Bushi (group of warriors guarding west side of imperial palace)
tit.cmt: カッコ内を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 西面武士（さいめんのぶし）とは、鎌倉時代、太上天皇に仕え、身辺の警衛、奉仕などにあたった武士集団のこと。
sen.e: "Saimen no Bushi" means a group of warriors who attended Daijo-tenno (the Retired Emperor) to guard and serve him in Kamakura Period.
"Saimen no Bushi" referred to a group of warriors who attended Daijo-tenno (the Retired Emperor), guarding and serving him during the Kamakura Period.
"Saimen no Bushi" referred to a group of warriors who attended Daijo-tenno (the Retired Emperor) by guarding and serving the emperor during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1200年ごろ、後鳥羽天皇が鎌倉幕府の軍事力に対抗して結成したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that it was organized by the Emperor Gotoba in around 1200 to vie with the military force of Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 原文の「後鳥羽天皇」は「後鳥羽上皇」の誤りと思われますが、原文通りに訳しておきました。
sen.e: It is said that it was organized by the Emperor Gotoba in around 1200 to vie with the military force of the Kamakura bakufu.
It is said that it was organized by the Emperor Gotoba in around 1200 to counter the military force organized by the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 倒幕準備のために創設したとする説の他、武芸を好んだ上皇が鎌倉幕府とは関係なく創設したとする説もある。
sen.e: Beside an opinion that the Saien no Bushi was founded in preparation to overthrow bakufu, there is another opinion that.it was created by the Retired Emperor who liked military arts without any relation to Kamakura bakufu.

While some say that the Saien no Bushi was founded in preparation to overthrow bakufu, there is another theory that says.it was created by the Retired Emperor who liked military arts, and that its creation had no relation to the Kamakura bakufu.

One of the theories has it that the Saimen no Bushi was organized in preparation to overthrow the bakufu, while another theory holds it that it was created by the Retired Emperor who simply liked military arts, and that it has no relation to the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 院御所の西面に詰め所などがあったので、この名がついている。
sen.e: It was named as Saimen no Bushi because its station was located at saimen (west side) of In no Gosho (the Retired Emperor's court.)
It was named as Saimen no Bushi because its station was located at saimen (west side) of In no Gosho (the Retired Emperor's court.)
The name Saimen no Bushi came from the fact that the worriors' station was located at saimen (west side) of In no Gosho (the Retired Emperor's court).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。アポストロフィを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 関東や在京の御家人を中心に構成されており西日本の有力御家人、武勇に優れた武士が多く所属していた。
sen.e: Being composed of gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) from Kanto and Kyoto, as its core members, it retained dominant gokenin from west Japan and other bushi (samurai) with outstanding military prowess.

Being composed of gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) from Kanto and Kyoto, as its core members, it retained dominant gokenin from west Japan and other bushi (samurai) having outstanding military prowess.

The group's central members were the gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogunate) from Kyoto and the eastern regions, and many powerful gokenin and other outstanding bushi (samurai) from the west Japan belonged to the group.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。アポストロフィを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: すでに上皇警護には白河天皇によって創設された北面武士があり、ともに院の軍事の中枢を担った。
sen.e: It played a central role in the military affairs of imperial palace, together with Hokumen no Bushi (a group of warriors guarding north side of imperial palace) which had already been formed by Emperor Shirakawa to guard the Retired Emperor.

It played a central role in the military affairs of the imperial palace, together with Hokumen no Bushi (a group of warriors guarding north side of imperial palace) which had already been formed by Emperor Shirakawa to guard the Retired Emperor.

Together with Hokumen no Bushi (a group of warriors guarding north side of imperial palace), which was organized by Emperor Shirakawa to guard the Retired Emperor earlier, Samen no Bushi played a central role in the military affairs of the imperial palace.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1221年の承久の乱においては上皇軍として参戦したが、一ヶ月あまりで鎮圧された。
sen.e: In 1221, it participated in Jokyu War as warriors of the Retired Emperor, but was suppressed after fighting for one month or so.
In 1221, they participated in the Jokyu War as warriors of the Retired Emperor, but were suppressed after fighting for a month or so.
In 1221, they participated in the Jokyu War as the army of the Retired Emperor, but were defeated after about one month of the battle.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。after about one month of battlebattle の前にtheを追加しました。

sen.j: 乱後、上皇の配流に伴い廃止された。
sen.e: After the Jokyu War, it was abolished when the Retired Emperor was exiled.
After the Jokyu War, they were abolished when the Retired Emperor was exiled.
After the Jokyu War, the group was dissolved when the Retired Emperor was sent to exile.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
